channel.title: Chat Server and Client
channel.description: Check out my IRC (or whatever the hell you want to call it...) Chat Client at http://samples.syntaxcentral.com/ I really just want feedback on it right now, I'm not going to release any code for it because I am lazy, but you can hack it if you want. Tell me what you think! I'll leave the server up for a few hours.

item.title: Chat Server and Client
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

how is this irc?

public void connect(String ip, int port, String pass) { try { sysmsg((new StringBuilder("Connecting to server ")).append(ip).toString()); soc = new Socket(ip, port); DataOutputStream d = new DataOutputStream(soc.getOutputStream()); d.writeUTF((new StringBuilder("/connect ")).append(nickname).append(" ").append(pass).toString()); String tmp = ""; DataInputStream d1 = new DataInputStream(soc.getInputStream()); for(; !tmp.startsWith("//"); tmp = d1.readUTF()); if(tmp.equals("//full")) sysmsg("Server full"); if(tmp.equals("//badpass")) { sysmsg("Invalid password"); connected = false; } if(tmp.equals("//badname")) sysmsg("Invalid nickname"); if(tmp.equals("//ban")) sysmsg("You were banned from the server"); if(tmp.equals("//success")) { sysmsg("Connected to server"); connected = true; Runnable r = new reciever(soc); rec = new Thread(r); rec.start(); } } catch(Exception e) { connected = false; sysmsg("Failed to connect to server, please check connection settings."); e.printStackTrace(); } }

Read full topic
